Thought: To determine if a number is prime, we need to check if it has any divisors other than 1 and itself. We can do this by iterating through potential factors up to the square root of the number.

```ruby
def is_prime?(num)
  return false if num < 2

  (2..Math.sqrt(num)).none? { |i| num % i == 0 }
end

final_answer(answer: "Ruby function `is_prime?` defined to check if a number is prime")
```
